function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Survival of the virus on different surfaces for extended periods","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of environmental conditions and surface temperature on virus activity","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Graphene oxide go and reduced graphene oxide rgo contain oxygen functional groups hydroxyl, carboxyl, carbonyl, and epoxy that affect their physicochemical properties.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Graphene derivatives with larger lateral size have stronger adsorption ability, which affects the physicochemical interaction with microorganisms.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased number of graphene layers can weaken the antimicrobial activity and cause increased aggregation tendency.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Graphene derivatives with antimicrobial properties","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cytotoxicity of graphene derivatives due to negatively charged groups","category":"Health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of promoting graphene derivatives as a primary solution for virus destruction","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sharp edges of graphene nano-walls inactivating bacteria and viruses, leading to potential reduction in survival rates.","category":"Health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Surface modifications of graphene influencing antimicrobial activities and antiviral properties.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Agglomeration causing weakened dispersibility and adsorption capacity of graphene, reducing efficacy against microorganisms.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Improper dispersion of nanomaterials like graphene and mnps may lead to reduced antimicrobial activity, allowing pathogens to spread","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate sterilization of frequently used surfaces can lead to continued transmission of pathogens","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overuse of surface disinfectant chemicals like sodium hypochlorite, hydrogen peroxide, or alcohol can have toxic effects and irritate occupants","category":"Health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of antimicrobial coatings with novel materials","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Debatable antimicrobial mechanism of graphene materials","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Interaction between bacteria and gbns containing surfaces","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of unproven materials for antiviral applications","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability of biocidal activity of graphene-based materials","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited understanding of the long-term effectiveness of graphene-based surface coatings against sars-cov-2","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of metal nanoparticles in high-performance coatings may pose a risk of environmental contamination and toxicity.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential risks associated with the use of graphene-based coatings for antiviral applications, including unknown long-term health effects and environmental impact.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges related to poor solubility and processing of graphene oxide go may hinder the fabrication of antimicrobial coatings.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of rna and dna viruses","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective antiviral composites","category":"Health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on concentration and exposure time","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to graphene family materials with antiviral properties","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Modification of properties using polymeric material and mnps","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mechanism of action of gbns against viruses","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Gbns penetrating cell membrane for physical disruption and rupture","category":"Health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Oxidative stress mechanism generating ros and damaging macromolecules of microorganisms","category":"Health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear effect of physicochemical features of gbns on antibacterial activity","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential reliance on unproven technology for virus inactivation","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited application reports and proof-of-concept scenarios","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential contamination of graphene-based products with sars-cov-2 during manufacturing or handling","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete or insufficient inactivation of sars-cov-2 on graphene-based coatings","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate disposal or recycling of graphene-based antiviral coatings","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of effective antiviral drug and vaccine","category":"Health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Agglomeration problems with gbns","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential misuse of mist spray and surface cleaner wipes","category":"Health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for ineffective antimicrobial coatings","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Over-reliance on nano-coatings for disease prevention","category":"Health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Long-term effectiveness and sustainability of antimicrobial coatings","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential toxicity of graphene-based nano materials when used in antiviral applications","category":"Health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges related to cost and processing of graphene-based coatings at different surfaces","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Accuracy, repeatability, and specificity challenges in detecting and preventing viruses using graphene-coated materials","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of complete assessment of cytotoxicity for antiviral materials","category":"Health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unpredictable bacterial and viral infections","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for treatments and approaches to combat specific viral proteins","category":"Health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in scalability, manufacturing costs, and accessibility of covid-19 vaccines","category":"Health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
